snippet: Supporters say Israel’s prime minister is playing his strong card, but opponents say he is scaring voters while offering few hopeful solutions leading to the March 17 elections.
abstract: Analysts say Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's speech to United States Congress urging tougher stance toward Iran's nuclear ambitions is likely to provide him with temporary boost ahead of March elections but may prove damaging to his chances overall; some Israelis feel that contentious speech was more damaging to Israel's safety than helpful.
lead_paragraph: Supporters say Israel’s prime minister is playing his strong card, but opponents say he is scaring voters while offering few hopeful solutions leading to the March 17 elections.

headline.main: Netanyahu May Gain Only a Fleeting Lift From His Speech, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu May Gain Only a Fleeting Lift From His Speech, Experts Say
